div.div: Enter a word or phrase to search our site

p.img: Sherri L. Washington was elected to the Rockdale County Board of Commissioners in November 2016 and took office January 1, 2016. She is a general practice attorney and founder of The Washington Law Group, PC. She earned her Bachelors and Master’s Degree from Savannah State University and then went on to obtain her Law Degree from Texas Southern University.

span.aria-label: Continue reading Sherri L. Washington, Post I

div.p: Chairman Oz Nesbitt, Sr., a native of Augusta, Georgia, is married to Robernett Nesbitt and they have two girls and two boys to their union. Chairman Nesbitt has served 15 years in Law Enforcement, studied at Voorhees College and is a member of the uplift organization 100 Black Men of America. He’s an award-winning speaker of Toastmasters International, the East Atlanta Networking Social, and the Who’s-Who Auto Sales Professionals.

span.aria-label: Continue reading Chairman Oz Nesbitt, Sr.

p.img: Dr. Doreen Williams was elected to the Rockdale County Board of Commissioners in November 2014 and took office January 1, 2015. She is a former small business owner and retired educator with a diverse educational background. She earned her Doctor of Education from Georgia Southern University in curriculum studies with concentrations on the role and influence of effective governments. Her master’s degree from Walden University concentrated on the effective use of technology. She also earned a bachelor’s degree in French from Brigham Young University.

span.aria-label: Continue reading Doreen Williams, Post II

p.iframe: ﻿﻿

h2.a: Rockdale County Courthouse Remains Open for Essential Court Business

div.p: PUBLIC NOTICE Revision Date: April 3, 2020 The Rockdale County Courthouse remains open for essential court business during the public health emergency. Every division of the Rockdale County Clerk of Superior and State Courts Office will be open for business Monday through Friday 8:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., however access to each service area will be restricted to scheduled appointments only. Should you need to conduct essential court business in-person at the Courthouse, please contact the applicable telephone number below…

h2.a: RDOT Awards Contract for Pavement Markings on 22 Miles of County Roadway

div.p: For Immediate Release April 23, 2020 RDOT Awards Contract for Pavement Markings on 22 Miles of County Roadway ROCKDALE COUNTY, Ga. – About 22 miles of roadway in Rockdale County will be restriped this year with more durable and visible road markings and new reflective raised pavement markers. Pittman Construction from Conyers, GA will continue with the SPLOST #2A Contract and utilize Peek Pavement Marking to refresh pavement markings on these 22 miles of arterial roadways, the most traveled…

h2.a: Order Requiring Masks While in the Common Areas of Rockdale County Courthouse

div.p: Order of the Courts Release Date: April 20, 2020 ORDER REQUIRING MASKS WHILE IN THE COMMON AREAS OF ROCKDALE COUNTY COURTHOUSE Pursuant to O.C.G.A. § 38-3-61, and due to the continuing statewide emergency involving the transmission of Coronavirus/COVID 19, the Honorable Chief Judge David B. Irwin of the Superior Court of Rockdale County and the undersigned Judges of the Rockdale Judicial Circuit HEREBY ORDERS as follows: IT IS THE ORDER of the Court that any person…

h2.a: Rockdale County Government Implements Hiring Freeze Amid Coronavirus Pandemic

div.p: For Immediate Release April 20, 2020 Rockdale County Government Implements Hiring Freeze Amid Coronavirus Pandemic ROCKDALE COUNTY, Ga. – Rockdale County Government is implementing a hiring freeze effective immediately. This hiring freeze will affect all Rockdale County Departments, except the Rockdale County Sheriff’s Office. The Rockdale County Department of Talent Management announced the hiring freeze the morning of Mon., April 20. The freeze is to last indefinitely and comes at a time when the County Offices are operating on…
